content:
StartupNextInstanceEventArgs Class

Definition

Provides data for the My.Application.StartupNextInstance event.

In this Article

[System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsable(System.ComponentModel.EditorBrowsableState.Advanced)]
public class StartupNextInstanceEventArgs : EventArgs
Inheritance
Object
System.EventArgs
StartupNextInstanceEventArgs

Inherited Members

Empty
Equals(Object)
Equals(Object,Object)
GetHashCode()
GetType()
MemberwiseClone()
ReferenceEquals(Object,Object)
ToString()

Remarks

The StartupNextInstance event occurs when a subsequent instance of a single-instance application starts, using the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model.

StartupNextInstanceEventArgs contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance and indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

Constructors

StartupNextInstanceEventArgs(ReadOnlyCollection<String>,Boolean)

Initializes a new instance of the StartupNextInstanceEventArgs class.

public StartupNextInstanceEventArgs (System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<string> args, bool bringToForegroundFlag);
args
ReadOnlyCollection<String>

A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 object that contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance.

bringToForegroundFlag
Boolean

A Boolean that indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

Remarks

The StartupNextInstance event occurs when a subsequent instance of a single-instance application starts, using the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model.

StartupNextInstanceEventArgs contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance and indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

Properties

BringToForeground

Indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

public bool BringToForeground { get; set; }
Value
Boolean

A Boolean that indicates whether the first application instance should be brought to the foreground upon exiting the exception handler.

Remarks

The Visual Basic Application Model checks the value of this property after running the handlers of the StartupNextInstance event. If the BringToForeground property is True, the first application instance is brought to the foreground. Otherwise, the first application instance remains where it was. For more information, see Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model.

CommandLine

Gets the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance.

public System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection<string> CommandLine { get; }
Value
ReadOnlyCollection<String>

A stem.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1 object that contains the command-line arguments of the subsequent application instance.

Remarks

The StartupNextInstance event occurs when a subsequent instance of a single-instance application starts, using the Visual Basic Application Model. For more information, see Overview of the Visual Basic Application Model.
